title: OnZen
author: OnZen
content: Hello Everyone  1 or 2 of my posts have been removed without notice. Earlier many of my posts were removed but I got notification in my message box... But this time I didn't get any notification. Is there any special reason for this?

comments.author: hosemary
comments.created_time: January 18, 2023, 09:04:55 AMLast edit: January 18, 2023, 09:15:01 AM by hosseinimr93
comments.body: If you didn't get any notification for the post that was deleted, it means that moderators didn't delete your post directly. They deleted the topic you posted it and that caused all the posts made in that thread to be removed.As far as I know, you also don't get any notification if your topic is moved to trashcan.

comments.author: Edwardard
comments.body: Quote from: OnZen on January 18, 2023, 09:01:24 AMHello Everyone  1 or 2 of my posts have been removed without notice. Earlier many of my posts were removed but I got notification in my message box... But this time I didn't get any notification. Is there any special reason for this?Are you talking about this plagiarised thread created by you? If an entire thread is deleted, you dont get notified I guess. And try to avoid spamming too much or you may also receive a temp. ban next time. I even suggested you to stop this in that (deleted) thread as well.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: Edwardard on January 18, 2023, 09:16:57 AMAre you talking about this plagiarised thread created by you? As I see in the archived version of that post on loyce.club, OP had added a link to the source. So, it shouldn't be considered as plagiarism. The user would be banned, if that post had been deleted due to plagiarism. That topic was deleted probably due to being a low-value post.

comments.author: Ryker1
comments.body: To my knowledge, you will get notified when a post is deleted if you are the OP on that thread or once you have reported to a moderator and your post was deleted due to spamming or a low-quality post, in that case --you must be notified.You will not get a notification once you posted in a deleted thread that was not created by you --or you replied in a spam thread.But I think there is no case about this but be careful posting and replying in spam threads.

comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.body: Quote from: OnZen on January 18, 2023, 09:01:24 AM<…>You can determine the deleted non-notified posts (belonging to deleted threads) yourself by looking over your recent history here:https://loyce.club/archive/members/352/3527025.htmlClick in the PostId link to see the message on Bitcointalk, and on the Scraped link to see the archived content.It seems that the deleted posts correspond to deleted threads, likely these:Quote•  Remove topic: MOVED: Why 2023 Is Important for the Future of Crypto? in topic #5435224 by member #3527025•  Remove topic: Why 2023 Is Important for the Future of Crypto? in topic #5435212 by member #3527025https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5435212.msg61607710#msg61607710https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5435224.msg61607789#msg61607789Derived from combining these:https://loyce.club/archive/members/352/3527025.htmlhttps://bitcointalk.org/modlog.phpNote: Currently, you seem to have has 25 posts deleted out of 57, which is not a promising ratio, and something to reflect upon.
